title: The College Nine
description: The College Nine Standing: Halter, Jackson, Rose, Mock, Quigley

title: Football Program Founded
description: Penn State's football program was established, beginning one of the most storied traditions in college athletics.

title: Track & Field Program Founded
description: Penn State establishes its Track & Field program, adding to the growing athletic tradition at the college.

title: Basketball Program Founded
description: Penn State's basketball program is established, joining the rapidly growing number of athletic programs at the college.

title: Wrestling Program Founded
description: Penn State establishes its wrestling program, which would go on to become one of the most decorated in NCAA history.

title: Soccer Program Founded
description: Penn State's soccer program is founded, expanding the university's growing athletic department.

title: Tennis Program Founded
description: Penn State's tennis program begins, adding yet another sport to the university's athletic offerings.

title: Track & Field Milestone
description: Penn State's Track & Field program reaches a significant milestone in its young history.

title: Lacrosse Program Founded
description: Penn State's lacrosse program is established, further broadening the university's athletic scope.

title: Boxing at Rec Hall
description: Boxing at Rec Hall drew large crowds during the 1920s and 1930s, becoming one of the most popular spectator sports on campus.

title: Golf Program Founded
description: Penn State's golf program is established, adding another dimension to the university's athletic tradition.

title: Rifle Program Founded
description: Penn State's rifle program begins at the White Building shooting range, establishing a precise athletic tradition.

title: Fencing Program Founded
description: Penn State's fencing program is established, adding an Olympic sport to the university's athletic portfolio.

title: Gymnastics Program Founded
description: Penn State's gymnastics program is established under what would become legendary coaching leadership.

title: Women's Rifle at White Building
description: Women's rifle practice at the White Building shooting range — Penn State was ahead of its time in providing athletic opportunities for women.

title: Cross-Country Runners
description: Cross-Country runners wind through campus, showcasing the beauty of Penn State's grounds and the endurance of its athletes.

title: Swimming & Diving Program Founded
description: Penn State's Swimming & Diving program is established, adding an aquatic dimension to the university's athletic tradition.

title: Billy Bonsall
description: Billy Bonsall shows strength on rings, exemplifying the elite-level gymnastics Penn State had developed under Coach Gene Wettstone.

title: Coach Bill Koll
description: A light moment with Hall of Fame wrestling coach Bill Koll, who helped cement Penn State's wrestling program as a national powerhouse.

title: International Gymnastics Meets
description: Lion coach Gene Wettstone promoted international meets like this one between the U.S. and Soviet Union at Rec Hall, putting Penn State on the global gymnastics map.

title: Dominant Softball Season
description: Lion softballers blasted opponents in 1974, going 10-1 in a dominant season that showcased the power of Penn State's women's athletics.

title: National Field Hockey Player of the Year
description: Leading scorer and 1981 National Field Hockey Player of the Year Candy Finn brings national recognition to Penn State's field hockey program.

title: Atlantic 10 Title Streak Begins
description: Point... Penn State! Lion women won seven straight Atlantic 10 titles from 1983–90, establishing a dynasty in collegiate volleyball.

title: Lady Lions Reclaim Atlantic 10
description: Lady Lion cagers were all smiles after reclaiming the Atlantic 10 title with an 84-60 win over St. Joseph's — a dominant performance.

title: First Big Ten Champions
description: Penn State claimed its first Big Ten baseball championship in 1996, a historic milestone for the program since joining the Big Ten Conference.

title: NCAA Wrestling Title
description: Hail to the victor! Glenn Pritzlaff celebrates his 1999 NCAA Title at 174lbs, adding to Penn State wrestling's storied championship legacy.
